ground_truth: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his quill and closes his book. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm, sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. In the corridor, Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound. Harry looks around nervously and, taking a deep breath, walks slowly around a corner, stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight, he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in mid-air, and a boy, Justin, lying petrified on the ground, his eyes wide open, his arms stuck out in front of him. Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers. Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin, Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall, over the stone windowsill, and out of the open window. As Harry watches them go, Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror. She walks briskly away, and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin, with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue, which slowly turns, and Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the griffin continues to revolve, Harry is gradually carried upwards. At the top, he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy wooden door swings open, and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head, he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat. As he stares at the crumpled hat, it starts to speak. The hat scowls, and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him, a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch. Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To his dismay, it suddenly bursts into flames. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch. Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash, and the baby bird opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Sure, here is the transformed text:

Even Ginny Weasley declines to meet his gaze. Harry sets down his pen and shuts his volume. He rises from the table and places his tomes under his arm, sensing that all the pupils are gazing at him as he swiftly strides out of the chamber. In the hallway, Harry perceives the bodiless voice again and trails the noise. Harry glances around anxiously and, taking a deep breath, strolls slowly around a bend, halting at the dreadful sight ahead of him. Lit by blazing torchlight, he observes the specter of Nearly Headless Nick suspended rigidly in mid-air, and a youth, Justin, lying immobilized on the ground, his eyes wide open, his arms thrust out in front of him. Harry crouches beside Justin and touches his rigid digits. Filch the caretaker materializes surreptitiously behind him. Still crouching beside the immobilized Justin, Harry observes a line of arachnids quickly scurrying across the floor. They follow one another up the wall, over the stone windowsill, and out of the open window. As Harry watches them depart, Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, who hastens along the hallway towards Harry and regards the spectacle with horror. She strides briskly away, and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch blazing on each side. Occupying the archway is a huge stone effigy of a griffin, with the head and extended wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long digits and aims them at the effigy, which slowly rotates, and Harry steps onto the spiral stairway behind it. As the griffin continues to rotate, Harry is gradually conveyed upwards. At the apex, he steps off and walks down a passageway towards a large wooden barrier leading to a cluttered, circular chamber lined with glass cabinets, the walls adorned with moving images of elderly sorcerers. The heavy wooden door swings open, and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old volumes. On one of the shelves high above his head, he notices a patched and shabby pointed cap. As he stares at the crumpled cap, it begins to speak. The cap frowns, and Harry turns as he hears a faint noise. Behind him, a decrepit bird with tatty orange plumage is balancing on a perch. Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To his dismay, it suddenly ignites into flames. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a heap of ash below its perch. Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head emerges from the heap of black ash, and the baby bird opens its beak.

She briskly walks away, and towards an archway he follows her with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is seen by him a huge stone statue of a griffin, with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Towards it, Harry steps. His long fingers are spread and pointed at the statue by Professor McGonagall, which slowly turns, and onto the circular staircase behind it, Harry steps. As the griffin continues to revolve, Harry is gradually carried upwards. At the top, off he steps and down a passage he walks towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy wooden door swings open, and cautiously inside, Harry peers. Up some steps, he walks into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head, sight is caught of a patched and shabby pointed hat. As the crumpled hat is stared at by him, it starts to speak. It scowls, and a faint sound is heard by Harry as he turns. Behind him, balancing on a perch is a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers. Towards the bird, Harry moves and at the odd-looking creature, he smiles. To his dismay, into flames it suddenly bursts. A step back is taken by Harry as into a pile of ash the bird becomes below its perch. At the top of a flight of stairs, Dumbledore appears just as a tiny head is poked out from the pile of black ash, and the baby bird opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley avoids eye contact with him. Harry lowers his quill, closes his book, and, sensing everyone staring, quickly leaves the room with his books under his arm. In the corridor, he hears a disembodied voice, follows it nervously, and encounters a horrifying scene: Nearly Headless Nick's ghost hangs in mid-air, and Justin lies petrified on the ground. Kneeling beside Justin, Harry touches his stiff fingers as Filch stealthily appears. Harry notices spiders scuttling across the floor and out an open window. Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, who hurries over and observes with horror. She leads Harry to an archway guarded by a griffin statue, which she activates. As it rotates, Harry ascends a circular staircase. At the top, he enters a cluttered room with glass cabinets and moving portraits. He then steps into a smaller room lined with old books, spotting a shabby hat that starts to speak. Hearing a noise, Harry turns to find a decrepit bird, which bursts into flames, leaving a pile of ash. As the tiny phoenix chick emerges, Dumbledore appears at the top of the stairs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Ginny Weasley refuses to meet Harry's eyes. Harry puts down his quill, closes his book, gathers his things, and notices everyone staring as he leaves. In the corridor, he hears a disembodied voice and follows it. Nervously, he turns a corner and sees Nearly Headless Nick's ghost hanging and Justin petrified on the ground. Harry kneels by Justin, touches his fingers, and sees spiders scuttling away. Filch arrives with Professor McGonagall, who leads Harry to an archway guarded by a griffin statue. She points, the statue turns, and Harry ascends a staircase behind it. At the top, he enters a circular room with portraits and cabinets. In a smaller room lined with books, he sees a shabby hat that speaks. Hearing a sound, Harry notices a decrepit bird with orange feathers bursting into flames. Stepping back, he watches as it becomes ashes. Dumbledore appears as a baby bird emerges from the ashes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Even Ginny Weasley, despite her usual friendliness, undoubtedly refuses to catch his eye. Harry, feeling the weight of the situation, gently places his quill aside and deliberately closes his book. With a sense of determination, he rises from the table, carefully tucking his books securely under his arm. Fully aware that he is the center of attention, he can almost feel the eyes of all the students in the room following him as he swiftly moves towards the exit and makes his way out. 

As he enters the corridor, Harry is startled to hear the mysterious, disembodied voice once again, compelling him to follow the eerie sound. While looking around with some trepidation, he takes a deep breath to steady himself and cautiously walks around a corner. Here, he is met with a shocking and horrible sight that makes him stop in his tracks. In the light provided by flickering torches, he is horrified to see Nearly Headless Nick's ghost hanging unnaturally rigid in mid-air. Nearby, a boy named Justin lies on the ground, petrified, with unblinking eyes and his arms awkwardly outstretched in front of him. 

Kneeling beside the motionless Justin, Harry reaches out to touch his stiff fingers, feeling the unnerving coldness. At that moment, Filch, the caretaker, inexplicably appears behind Harry, approaching with his usual stealth. Remaining in his kneeling position next to the petrified Justin, Harry's attention is suddenly drawn to a line of spiders scurrying hurriedly across the floor. He watches as they trail each other up the wall, over the stone windowsill, and eventually disappear through the open window. 

As Harry's attention follows the departing spiders, Filch returns, this time accompanied by Professor McGonagall. She rushes down the corridor towards Harry, her face filled with horror as she takes in the disturbing scene. Without wasting any time, she turns on her heel and moves briskly away, while Harry follows her lead. They soon arrive at an archway, dramatically flanked by blazing torches. Dominating the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin, its majestic form featuring the proud head and wide-spanning wings of an eagle combined with the powerful body of a lion. 

Harry steps forward with curiosity. As Professor McGonagall spreads her elegant fingers and precisely points them at the statue, it slowly begins to rotate. Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it, feeling a sense of wonder as he is gently but steadily carried upwards. Once he reaches the top, he steps off and proceeds down a passageway leading to a large wooden door. This door opens into a cluttered, circular room where glass cabinets line the walls, which are adorned with numerous moving portraits of elderly wizards. 

The heavy wooden door swings open, and Harry peers inside with a sense of caution. Ascending some steps, he eventually finds himself in a smaller room with shelves filled with old books. Among the many books, high above his head, his eyes catch sight of a patched, shabby, pointed hat resting on one of the shelves. As Harry gazes intently at the crumpled hat, much to his surprise, it suddenly begins to speak with a scowl. 

Startled by the hat’s unexpected speech, Harry turns around at the faint sound he hears behind him. He notices a decrepit bird perched nearby, its tatty orange feathers making it look rather peculiar. Harry approaches the bird with a smile, appreciating its odd appearance, but to his great dismay, the creature unexpectedly bursts into flames. He instinctively takes a step back as the once-living bird transforms into a pile of ash beneath its perch. Just at that precise moment, Dumbledore makes his appearance at the top of a flight of stairs. In a remarkable turn of events, a tiny head emerges from the pile of black ash below, and the baby bird opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Even Ginny Weasley, who is known for her usual friendliness and warmth towards everyone, unmistakably refuses to meet his gaze or catch his eye. Harry, feeling the immense weight of the situation pressing down on him, gently places his quill aside with care and purposefully closes his book with a decisive motion. With a renewed sense of determination and purpose, he rises from the table, carefully tucking his books securely under his arm, ensuring they are safe. Fully aware that he is the center of attention in the room, he can almost feel the eyes of all the students around him following his every move as he swiftly makes his way towards the exit and eventually exits the room.

As he steps into the corridor, Harry is startled and taken aback to hear the mysterious and eerie disembodied voice once again, compelling him to follow its unsettling sound. He looks around with some trepidation and a sense of unease, taking a deep breath to steady himself before cautiously walking around a corner. It is here that he is met with a shocking and horrifying sight that makes him stop in his tracks. In the dim light provided by flickering torches, he is horrified to see Nearly Headless Nick's ghost hanging in mid-air, unnaturally rigid and still. Nearby, a boy named Justin lies on the ground, petrified and motionless, with unblinking eyes and his arms awkwardly outstretched in front of him.

Kneeling beside the motionless Justin, Harry reaches out with his hand to touch the boy’s stiff fingers, feeling the unnerving coldness that has taken over him. At that moment, Filch, the caretaker, inexplicably appears behind Harry, approaching with his usual stealth and quiet manner. Remaining in his kneeling position next to the petrified Justin, Harry's attention is suddenly drawn to the sight of a line of spiders scurrying hurriedly across the floor. He watches intently as they trail one after the other up the wall, over the cold stone windowsill, and eventually disappear through the open window into the unknown.

As Harry's attention follows the departing spiders, Filch returns, this time joined by Professor McGonagall. She rushes down the corridor towards Harry with urgency, her face filled with horror and disbelief as she takes in the disturbing scene before her. Without wasting any time, she turns on her heel and moves briskly away, indicating for Harry to follow her lead. They soon arrive at an impressive archway, dramatically flanked by blazing torches on either side. Dominating the archway is a grand stone statue of a griffin, its majestic form featuring the proud head and wide-spanning wings of an eagle combined with the powerful body of a lion.

Harry steps forward with a sense of curiosity and intrigue. As Professor McGonagall spreads her elegant fingers and precisely points them at the statue, it slowly begins to rotate before them. Harry steps onto the circular staircase that appears behind it, feeling a sense of wonder and amazement as he is gently but steadily carried upwards. Once he reaches the top of the staircase, he steps off and proceeds down a passageway that leads to a large wooden door. This door opens into a cluttered and circular room where glass cabinets line the walls, which are adorned with numerous moving portraits of elderly wizards.

The heavy wooden door swings open, and Harry peers inside with a sense of caution and anticipation. Ascending some steps, he eventually finds himself in a smaller room with shelves filled with old and dusty books. Among the many books perched high above his head, his eyes catch sight of a patched, shabby, and pointed hat resting on one of the shelves. As Harry gazes intently at the crumpled hat, much to his surprise, it suddenly begins to speak with a scowl, adding to the mystery of the moment.

Startled by the hat’s unexpected speech, Harry quickly turns around at the faint sound he hears behind him. He notices a decrepit bird perched nearby, its tatty orange feathers giving it a rather peculiar and odd appearance. Harry approaches the bird with a smile, appreciating its strange look, but to his great dismay, the creature unexpectedly bursts into flames. He instinctively takes a step back, watching in surprise as the once-living bird transforms into a pile of ash beneath its perch. Just at that precise moment, Dumbledore makes his appearance at the top of a flight of stairs. In a remarkable turn of events, a tiny head emerges from the pile of black ash below, and the baby bird opens its beak, signaling the cycle of rebirth.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley makes a conscious decision to avoid catching his eye, prompting Harry to put down his quill with a subtle movement and close his book with a soft thud. Rising deliberately from the table, he carefully gathers his collection of books, tucking them securely under his arm. As he does so, he can almost feel the eyes of every student in the room upon him, watching with an intensity that makes the air seem thicker. He quickly makes his way out of the room, his footsteps echoing in the sudden quiet. Once in the corridor, Harry halts momentarily as the familiar, unsettling disembodied voice reaches his ears once more. Driven by a mixture of curiosity and trepidation, he follows the elusive sound, looking around with a nervous darting of his eyes. Drawing in a deep breath to steady himself, he walks cautiously around the corner, only to abruptly stop, confronted by a scene both surreal and chilling. Bathed in the flickering glow of the flaming torches that line the walls, the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick appears suspended in mid-air, frozen in a stiff posture. Beneath him lies a boy, Justin, petrified on the cold stone floor, his eyes locked wide open, his arms extended rigidly before him. Compelled by concern, Harry kneels down beside Justin, reaching out tentatively to touch his unyielding fingers. At that moment, Filch the caretaker emerges unexpectedly, his presence almost spectral in its stealth. Still on his knees beside the motionless Justin, Harry's attention is caught by a line of spiders, their movements quick and purposeful as they scuttle across the floor. He observes them with a mix of intrigue and dread, watching as they march in single file up the wall, over the weathered stone windowsill, and out into the open world beyond. But his observation is cut short as Filch returns, this time with Professor McGonagall in tow. She hurries down the corridor towards him, her expression swiftly shifting to one of horror as she comprehends the scene before her. Without hesitation, she turns and walks briskly away, prompting Harry to follow her. They move towards an archway flanked by fiery torches, where a grand stone statue of a griffin stands sentinel, its eagle head and outstretched wings contrasting with its lion's body. Approaching the statue, Harry watches as Professor McGonagall spreads her fingers with a deliberate elegance, pointing them towards the statue. In response, the stone griffin begins to turn, revealing a hidden circular staircase. Harry steps onto it, and the revolving motion gently carries him upwards. As he reaches the top, he steps off the staircase and proceeds down a passage that leads him to a large wooden door. He pushes it open to reveal a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, its walls festooned with portraits of elderly wizards, each one animated with life. Stepping into the room, Harry ascends a small set of steps into a more intimate space, where shelves brimming with old books rise towards the ceiling. His gaze travels upwards until it settles on a shelf above, where he spots a patched and shabby pointed hat perched incongruously. To his surprise, as he focuses on the crumpled hat, it begins to speak with a knowing scowl. Just then, Harry's attention is diverted by a faint sound behind him. Turning, he sees a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers precariously balancing on a perch. Drawn by curiosity, Harry moves closer, offering a tentative smile to the odd bird. However, his expression shifts to one of shock and dismay when the bird unexpectedly bursts into flames, its body disintegrating into a pile of ash beneath the perch. Startled, Harry instinctively takes a step back. But amid the blackened piles of ash, a tiny head slowly emerges, a baby bird pushing its way into the world and opening its beak as Dumbledore arrives at the top of a flight of stairs, observing the transformation with a serene presence.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye, prompting Harry to put down his quill, close his book, and gather his belongings, sensing the students' stares as he swiftly exits the room. In the corridor, he hears the disembodied voice again and follows it, nervously navigating around a corner to find Nearly Headless Nick's ghost and Justin lying petrified. Kneeling beside Justin, Harry touches his stiff fingers and notices a line of spiders skittering away as Filch arrives with Professor McGonagall, who surveys the scene with horror. She leads Harry through an archway with a griffin statue, which rotates to reveal a staircase that carries Harry upwards. At the top, Harry enters a circular room adorned with glass cabinets and portraits, moving cautiously into a smaller adjoining room with shelves of old books. He notices a patched hat that begins to speak, and, turning at a sound, sees a decrepit bird. As Harry approaches and smiles, the bird bursts into flames, reducing to ash. Dumbledore appears as a baby bird emerges from the ashes, revealing the cycle of rebirth.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley, a member of the renowned Weasley family known for their bravery and strong ties to Hogwarts, refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his quill and closes his book, which contains the challenging spells and magical theories they are currently studying in Defense Against the Dark Arts. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm, sensing that all the students, who have recently been whispering rumors about him, are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. In the corridor of Hogwarts, the ancient castle known for its enchanted architecture and mysterious corridors, Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound. Harry looks around nervously and, taking a deep breath, walks slowly around a corner, stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight, he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick, the Gryffindor house ghost who was beheaded in a botched execution in 1492, hanging stiffly in mid-air, and a boy, Justin Finch-Fletchley from Hufflepuff, lying petrified on the ground, his eyes wide open, his arms stuck out in front of him. Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers. Filch the caretaker, notorious for his disdain towards students, appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin, Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall, over the stone windowsill, and out of the open window, seemingly escaping from an unseen threat. As Harry watches them go, Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, the stern Deputy Headmistress and Transfiguration professor, who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror. She walks briskly away, and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin, a mythical creature symbolizing courage and leadership, with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue, which slowly turns, revealing that it conceals a secret passage. Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the griffin continues to revolve, Harry is gradually carried upwards to the headmaster's office. At the top, he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards, some of whom were former headmasters. The heavy wooden door swings open, and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books, many of which contain ancient and powerful magic spells. On one of the shelves high above his head, he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat, the Sorting Hat, which originally belonged to Godric Gryffindor and decides students' Hogwarts houses. As he stares at the crumpled hat, it starts to speak, offering cryptic advice. The hat scowls, and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him, a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch, which Harry recognizes as Fawkes, Dumbledore's phoenix known for its ability to be reborn from its ashes. Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To his dismay, it suddenly bursts into flames, a natural part of a phoenix's life cycle. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch. Dumbledore, the wise and revered headmaster of Hogwarts, appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash, and the baby bird opens its beak, marking the rebirth of Fawkes.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his quill and closes his book. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. In the corridor Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound. Harry looks around nervously and taking a deep breath walks slowly around a corner stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in midair and a boy Justin lying petrified on the ground his eyes wide open his arms stuck out in front of him. Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers. Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall over the stone windowsill and out of the open window. As Harry watches them go Filch returns with Professor McGonagall who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror. She walks briskly away and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue which slowly turns and Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the griffin continues to revolve Harry is gradually carried upwards. At the top he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered circular room lined with glass cabinets the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy wooden door swings open and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat. As he stares at the crumpled hat it starts to speak. The hat scowls and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch. Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the oddlooking creature. To his dismay it suddenly bursts into flames. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch. Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash and the baby bird opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his quill and closes his book. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. In the corridor Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound. Harry looks around nervously and taking a deep breath walks slowly around a corner stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in midair and a boy Justin lying petrified on the ground his eyes wide open his arms stuck out in front of him. Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers. Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall over the stone windowsill and out of the open window. As Harry watches them go Filch returns with Professor McGonagall who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror. She walks briskly away and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue which slowly turns and Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the griffin continues to revolve Harry is gradually carried upwards. At the top he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered circular room lined with glass cabinets the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy wooden door swings open and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat. As he stares at the crumpled hat it starts to speak. The hat scowls and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch. Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the oddlooking creature. To his dismay it suddenly bursts into flames. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch. test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his quill and closes his book. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. To his dismay it suddenly bursts into flames. Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Hermione Granger refuses to catch his eye. Ron puts down his quill and closes his book. He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm, sensing that all the ghosts are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room. In the corridor, Ron hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound. Ron looks around nervously and, taking a deep breath, walks slowly around a corner, stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight, he sees the ghost of Moaning Myrtle hanging stiffly in mid-air, and a cat, Crookshanks, lying petrified on the ground, its eyes wide open, its arms stuck out in front of it. Ron kneels beside Crookshanks and touches its stiff fingers. Hagrid the groundskeeper appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Crookshanks, Ron notices a line of owls quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall, over the stone windowsill, and out of the open window. As Ron watches them go, Hagrid returns with Professor Snape, who hurries along the corridor towards Ron and regards the scene with horror. He walks briskly away, and Ron follows him towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side. Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a dragon, with the head and outstretched wings of a bat and the body of a tiger. Ron steps towards it. Professor Snape spreads his long fingers and points them at the statue, which slowly turns, and Ron steps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the dragon continues to revolve, Ron is gradually carried upwards. At the top, he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly witches. The heavy wooden door swings open, and Ron peers cautiously inside. Ron walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head, he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat. As he stares at the crumpled hat, it starts to speak. The hat scowls, and Ron turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him, a decrepit toad with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch. Ron moves towards the toad and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To his dismay, it suddenly bursts into flames. Ron takes a step back as the toad becomes a pile of ash below its perch. McGonagall appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash, and the baby toad opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye. Harry puts down his pencil and closes his newspaper. He gets up from the bench and puts his newspapers under his arm, sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the cabin. In the hallway, Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the noise. Harry looks around nervously and, taking a deep breath, walks slowly around a corner, stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him. Lit by glowing lamplight, he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in mid-air, and a boy, Justin, lying petrified on the carpet, his eyes wide open, his arms stuck out in front of him. Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers. Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him. Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin, Harry notices a line of ants quickly scuttling across the floor. They follow each other up the wall, over the stone mantelpiece, and out of the open window. As Harry watches them go, Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, who hurries along the hallway towards Harry and regards the scene with horror. She walks briskly away, and Harry follows her towards a doorway with a glowing lantern hanging on each side. Filling the doorway is a huge metal statue of a chimera, with the head and outstretched wings of an owl and the body of a tiger. Harry steps towards it. Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue, which slowly turns, and Harry steps onto the circular ramp behind it. As the chimera continues to revolve, Harry is gradually carried upwards. At the top, he steps off and walks down a corridor towards a large glass door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with metal shelves, the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy glass door swings open, and Harry peers cautiously inside. Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old scrolls. On one of the shelves high above his head, he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed scarf. As he stares at the crumpled scarf, it starts to whisper. The scarf scowls, and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound. Behind him, a decrepit owl with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a branch. Harry moves towards the owl and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To his dismay, it suddenly bursts into flames. Harry takes a step back as the owl becomes a pile of ash below its branch. Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of ramps just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash, and the baby owl opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to meet his eye. Harry picks up his quill and opens his book. He sits down at the table and places his books beside him, sensing that all the students are whispering about him as he slowly shuffles out of the room. In the corridor, Harry ignores the disembodied voice again and walks away from the sound. Harry glances around anxiously and, holding his breath, stumbles quickly around a corner, marveling at the wonderful sight ahead of him. Lit by flaming torchlight, he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick floating serenely in mid-air, and a boy, Justin, standing confused on the ground, his eyes wide open, his arms crossed in front of him. Harry stands beside Justin and nudges his arm gently. Filch the caretaker emerges boldly behind him. Still standing beside the bewildered Justin, Harry observes a line of spiders lazily meandering across the floor. They part ways at the wall, over the stone windowsill, and out of the closed window. As Harry waves them goodbye, Filch appears with Professor McGonagall, who drifts along the corridor towards Harry and observes the scene with intrigue. She strides calmly away, and Harry trails behind her towards an archway with a dim torch flickering on each side. Filling the archway is a large stone statue of a griffin, with the head and drooping wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Harry approaches it. Professor McGonagall claps her long fingers and raises them at the statue, which quickly rotates, and Harry leaps onto the circular staircase behind it. As the griffin continues to whirl, Harry is gradually lowered downwards. At the bottom, he steps off and tiptoes down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered, circular room lined with glass cabinets, the walls adorned with still portraits of elderly wizards. The heavy wooden door creaks open, and Harry gazes cautiously inside. Harry climbs down some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books. On one of the shelves high above his head, he notices a patched and shabby pointed hat. As he studies the tattered hat, it begins to sing. The hat chuckles, and Harry turns as he hears a gentle sound. Behind him, a regal bird with pristine orange feathers is resting on a perch. Harry approaches the bird and laughs at the quirky creature. To his surprise, it suddenly disappears into thin air. Harry takes a step forward as the bird reappears as a pile of flowers below its perch. Dumbledore materializes at the bottom of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head peeks out from the pile of colorful flowers, and the baby bird chirps softly.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Even the tulip refuses to catch its whisper. The penguin puts down its shoelace and closes its notebook. It gets up from the hammock and puts its notebooks under its hat, sensing that all the kangaroos are staring at it as it quickly walks out of the igloo. In the garden, the penguin hears the disembodied avocado again and follows the sound. The penguin looks around nervously and, taking a deep breath, walks slowly around a puddle, stopping at the horrible candy cane ahead of it. Lit by flaming streetlight, it sees the dolphin of Nearly Headless Rex hanging stiffly in mid-air, and a chair, Marshmallow, lying petrified on the grass, its eyes wide open, its arms stuck out in front of it. The penguin kneels beside Marshmallow and touches its stiff noodles. The giraffe the veterinarian appears stealthily behind it. Still kneeling beside the petrified Marshmallow, the penguin notices a line of donuts quickly scuttling across the street. They follow each other up the tree, over the stone rainbow, and out of the open chasm. As the penguin watches them go, the giraffe returns with the librarian, who hurries along the garden towards the penguin and regards the scene with horror. It walks briskly away, and the penguin follows it towards a carousel with a fiery lantern burning on each side. Filling the carousel is a huge metal windmill of a walrus, with the head and outstretched wings of a butterfly and the body of a fox. The penguin steps towards it. The librarian spreads its spindly toes and points them at the windmill, which slowly turns, and the penguin steps onto the circular elevator behind it. As the walrus continues to revolve, the penguin is gradually carried upwards. At the top, it steps off and walks down a hallway towards a large velvet curtain leading to a cluttered, circular pavilion lined with glass canoes, the walls hung with moving photographs of sleepy witches. The heavy velvet curtain swings open, and the penguin peers cautiously inside. The penguin walks up some steps into a smaller cavern lined with shelves of old lamps. On one of the shelves high above its antenna, it catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed boot. As it stares at the crumpled boot, it starts to sing. The boot scowls, and the penguin turns as it hears a faint whisper. Behind it, a decrepit turtle with tatty orange scales is balancing on a perch. The penguin moves towards the turtle and smiles at the odd-looking creature. To its dismay, it suddenly bursts into flames. The penguin takes a step back as the turtle becomes a pile of ash below its perch. The chef appears at the top of a flight of slides just as a tiny fin pokes out from the pile of black ash, and the baby turtle opens its beak.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Luna Lovegood avoids to meet his gaze. Ron drops his pen and shuts his journal. He rises from the bench and tucks his papers under his jacket, feeling that all the teachers are glaring at him as he swiftly marches out of the hall. In the hallway, Ron detects the echoing noise once more and tracks the noise. Ron glances around anxiously and, exhaling slowly, strides cautiously around a bend, halting at the dreadful vision ahead of him. Illuminated by flickering candlelight, he spots the specter of Moaning Myrtle hovering solemnly in mid-air, and a girl, Hannah, lying motionless on the ground, her eyes staring wide, her hands frozen in front of her. Ron crouches beside Hannah and taps her rigid fingers. Peeves the poltergeist emerges sneakily behind him. Still crouching beside the motionless Hannah, Ron observes a trail of beetles briskly darting across the tiles. They trail each other up the wall, over the stone frame, and out of the ajar window. As Ron observes their departure, Peeves returns with Hagrid, who rushes along the hallway towards Ron and surveys the scene with shock. She paces quickly away, and Ron trails her towards an entrance with a blazing candle flickering on each side. Filling the entryway is an enormous metal likeness of a dragon, with the head and spread wings of an owl and the torso of a tiger. Ron moves towards it. Hagrid unfurls her wide hands and gestures them at the likeness, which gradually spins, and Ron steps onto the revolving platform behind it. As the dragon continues to spin, Ron is slowly lifted upwards. At the top, he disembarks and strolls down a corridor towards a massive iron gate leading to a cluttered, round hall lined with glass displays, the walls adorned with animated portraits of ancient witches. The solid iron gate swings open, and Ron peers cautiously within. Ron ascends a few steps into a smaller chamber lined with racks of ancient manuscripts. On one of the racks high above his head, he notices a patched and tattered umbrella. As he gawks at the wrinkled umbrella, it begins to sing. The umbrella grimaces, and Ron turns as he detects a distant murmur. Behind him, a shabby cat with scraggly green fur is balancing on a beam. Ron approaches the cat and grins at the peculiar animal. To his shock, it suddenly crumbles into embers. Ron takes a step backward as the cat turns into a mound of dust beneath its beam. Snape appears at the top of a ladder just as a tiny paw pops out from the pile of gray dust, and the infant cat opens its mouth.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Ginny Weasley refuses to meet his gaze. Harry places down his feather and shuts his notebook. He stands from the chair and tucks his scrolls beneath his elbow, feeling that all the teachers are whispering about him as he leisurely meanders out of the hall. In the passageway, Harry perceives the invisible melody once more and drifts toward the echo. Harry peers around cautiously and, exhaling slowly, wanders leisurely around a bend, halting at the horrifying spectacle ahead of him. Illuminated by flickering lantern light, he sees the phantom of Nearly Headless Nick swaying limply in mid-air, and a child, Justin, lying frozen on the tiles, his eyes wide in terror, his legs extended beneath him. Harry crouches beside Justin and taps his stiff toes. Filch the watchman emerges quietly behind him. Still crouched beside the frozen Justin, Harry observes a line of beetles slowly creeping across the ceiling. They trail each other down the wall, past the wooden sill, and into the closed window. As Harry observes them disappear, Filch returns with Professor McGonagall, who rushes along the hall towards Harry and surveys the scene with dread. She strides swiftly away, and Harry trails her toward an archway with a radiant lantern illuminating each side. Filling the archway is a colossal metal sculpture of a dragon, with the head and folded wings of a hawk and the body of a panther. Harry approaches it. Professor McGonagall waves her slender palms and gestures them at the sculpture, which gradually rotates, and Harry steps onto the spiral ladder behind it. As the dragon continues to spin, Harry is gently lifted upwards. At the summit, he steps off and strolls down a corridor towards a vast metal gate leading to a cluttered, circular area lined with crystal shelves, the walls adorned with shifting images of ancient sorcerers. The hefty metal gate swings open, and Harry glances warily inside. Harry ascends some stairs into a smaller space lined with racks of aged tomes. On one of the racks high above his head, he notices a patched and tattered conical helmet. As he gazes at the crumpled helmet, it begins to sing. The helmet frowns, and Harry turns as he hears a faint rustle. Behind him, an old turtle with frayed green scales is balancing on a log. Harry approaches the turtle and grins at the peculiar creature. To his dismay, it suddenly disintegrates into dust. Harry takes a step back as the turtle becomes a mound of soot beneath its log. Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of ladders just as a tiny shell emerges from the mound of black soot, and the baby turtle opens its mouth.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Even Winston Whiskers declines to grasp the monkey's paw. Rupert places down his screwdriver and seals his map. He rises from the sofa and tucks his maps behind his back, sensing that all the squirrels are glaring at him as he hurriedly skips out of the spaceship. In the meadow, Rupert hears the ethereal melody again and shadows the tune. Rupert glances around anxiously and, inhaling deeply, tiptoes cautiously around a tree, pausing at the delightful spectacle before him. Illuminated by moonlight, he sees the shadow of Nearly Featherless Fred dangling gently in the starry sky, and a sheep, Gerald, reclining mesmerized on the grass, its eyes shut tight, its hooves pointing upwards. Rupert crouches beside Gerald and pats his rigid hooves. Grim the gardener appears quietly behind him. Still crouching beside the mesmerized Gerald, Rupert observes a trail of ants rapidly marching across the soil. They follow each other down the hill, over the mossy log, and into the open tunnel. As Rupert watches them leave, Grim returns with Professor Snapdragon, who dashes across the meadow towards Rupert and surveys the display with amazement. She strolls quickly away, and Rupert trails her towards an entrance with a glowing lantern dangling on each side. Filling the entrance is a colossal marble sculpture of a unicorn, with the mane and spread-out wings of a dragon and the tail of a fox. Rupert edges towards it. Professor Snapdragon unfurls her slender toes and taps them at the sculpture, which slowly pivots, and Rupert steps onto the spiraling lift behind it. As the unicorn continues to spin, Rupert is gradually elevated. At the summit, he disembarks and strolls down a corridor towards a massive iron gate leading to a cluttered, circular chamber lined with brass cages, the walls decorated with floating pictures of ancient sorcerers. The massive iron gate swings ajar, and Rupert peers intently inside. Rupert climbs some ladders into a tighter nook lined with racks of dusty globes. On one of the racks high above his nose, he glimpses a patched and shabby triangular shield. As he gazes at the rumpled shield, it begins to sing. The shield grimaces, and Rupert swivels as he hears a distant murmur. Behind him, a worn-out turtle with frayed pink shells is balancing on a ledge. Rupert strides towards the turtle and grins at the peculiar creature. To his surprise, it abruptly vanishes into sparks. Rupert retreats a step as the turtle diminishes into a mound of soot below its ledge. Merlin pops up at the summit of a rope ladder just as a tiny shell emerges from the mound of charcoal, and the infant turtle opens its mouth.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry, feeling isolated, notices everyone's eyes on him as he leaves the room. In the corridor, he hears a mysterious voice and follows it, confronting a chilling scene: Nearly Headless Nick's ghost hangs in the air, and Justin lies petrified. Harry kneels by Justin, observing spiders scuttling away. Filch arrives with Professor McGonagall, who leads Harry to a gryphon statue that rotates, revealing a staircase. Ascending, Harry finds himself in a room filled with portraits of wizards and a speaking hat. A decrepit bird catches fire, reducing to ash, but a baby bird emerges as Dumbledore arrives.

points them at the statue which slowly turns and Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the oddlooking creature To his dismay it suddenly bursts into flames As Harry watches them go Filch returns with Professor McGonagall who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror They follow each other up the wall over the stone windowsill and out of the open window At the top he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered circular room lined with glass cabinets the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards As he stares at the crumpled hat it starts to speak Behind him a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers Harry looks around nervously and taking a deep breath walks slowly around a corner stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room The hat scowls and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound Harry steps towards it Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash and the baby bird opens its beak Lit by flaming torchlight he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in midair and a boy Justin lying petrified on the ground his eyes wide open his arms stuck out in front of him Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor She walks briskly away and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side As the griffin continues to revolve Harry is gradually carried upwards On one of the shelves high above his head he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him The heavy wooden door swings open and Harry peers cautiously inside In the corridor Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound Harry puts down his quill and closes his book Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Professor McGonagall spreads her long fingers and points them at the statue which slowly turns and Harry steps onto the circular staircase behind it As the griffin continues to revolve Harry is gradually carried upwards At the top he steps off and walks down a passage towards a large wooden door leading to a cluttered circular room lined with glass cabinets the walls hung with moving portraits of elderly wizards The heavy wooden door swings open and Harry peers cautiously inside Harry walks up some steps into a smaller room lined with shelves of old books On one of the shelves high above his head he catches sight of a patched and shabby pointed hat As he stares at the crumpled hat it starts to speak The hat scowls and Harry turns as he hears a faint sound Behind him a decrepit bird with tatty orange feathers is balancing on a perch Harry moves towards the bird and smiles at the oddlooking creature To his dismay it suddenly bursts into flames Harry takes a step back as the bird becomes a pile of ash below its perch Dumbledore appears at the top of a flight of stairs just as a tiny head pokes out from the pile of black ash and the baby bird opens its beak Even Ginny Weasley refuses to catch his eye Harry puts down his quill and closes his book He gets up from the table and puts his books under his arm sensing that all the students are staring at him as he quickly walks out of the room In the corridor Harry hears the disembodied voice again and follows the sound Harry looks around nervously and taking a deep breath walks slowly around a corner stopping at the horrible sight ahead of him Lit by flaming torchlight he sees the ghost of Nearly Headless Nick hanging stiffly in midair and a boy Justin lying petrified on the ground his eyes wide open his arms stuck out in front of him Harry kneels beside Justin and touches his stiff fingers Filch the caretaker appears stealthily behind him Still kneeling beside the petrified Justin Harry notices a line of spiders quickly scuttling across the floor They follow each other up the wall over the stone windowsill and out of the open window As Harry watches them go Filch returns with Professor McGonagall who hurries along the corridor towards Harry and regards the scene with horror She walks briskly away and Harry follows her towards an archway with a fiery torch burning on each side Filling the archway is a huge stone statue of a griffin with the head and outstretched wings of an eagle and the body of a lion Harry steps towards it
